title: dist: windows install cleared PATH variable
body:
by **M.Lewen**: 
I just downloaded and installed "go1.0.3.windows-amd64.msi" on my 64-bit
Windows 7 Professional (SP 1) system, and instead of adding "C:\Go\bin" to my
PATH variable, it completely wiped it.
The GOROOT variable was created with no problems.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.
1. Download http://go.googlecode.com/files/go1.0.3.windows-amd64.msi
2. Install it

What is the expected output?
- Working installation

What do you see instead?
- PATH variable wiped

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
-

Which operating system are you using?
- Windows 7 Professional x64(AMD), Service Pack 1  

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
- 1.0.3

Please provide any additional information below.
- manually recreating the PATH and adding C:\Go\bin results in a working installation
